segments.text: I see the woman so engrossed in her task at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water's flowing out, but she's not reacting at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's puddling around her feet, silent and sneaky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting drenched, what a waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now looking left, the boy's climbing for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool doesn't look stable, it's leaning back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got his hand in the jar, pulling out treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, palm up, ready to catch one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They make a cute team, don't they?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can't shake this worry about the fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in light, brightening the room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, everything's perfect, unlike this indoor chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
